unnormalised: So, someone asked what are some common internet terms used in India? Good question! We use a lot of desi-fied versions of standard terms, plus a few unique ones. First off, everyone here knows what "net banking" is. Basically online banking, but we call it that. It’s super common, especially with the rise of UPI and all that jazz.

unnormalised: Then there's the whole "data pack" thing. Instead of saying "mobile data plan," most people just say "I need to recharge my data pack." You'll hear that phrase everywhere, from your local kirana store offering recharges to your tech-savvy friends. And don’t forget "OTPs"! Everyone gets them – for banking, for logging in, for pretty much everything online. Gotta keep those accounts secure, bhai!
